Class Student

java.lang.Object
Person
Student
public class Student
extends Person
This class defines a Student object. It provides all the properties and methods necessary to manage a student in the bigger context of the School. Each student, apart from the properties inherited from Person, has also an attendedCourses ArrayList containing all the courses the student is enrolled in, and a certificates ArrayList containing all the subjectIDs of the subjects that he or she has already taken.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Giovanni Arcudi

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the student
      gender - student's gender: male (â€˜Mâ€™) or female (â€˜Fâ€™)
      age - how old the student is, in years

      public void addAttendedCourse​(Course attendedCourse)
      Adds the Course object passed as parameter to the attendedCourses ArrayList.

    • getAttendedSubject

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAttendedSubject()
      Returns an ArrayList of all the Subjects the student is studying, deriving them from the attendedCourses ArrayList.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList containing all the courses the student is attending

    • graduate

      public void graduate​(Subject subject)
      Adds the ID of the subject to the certificates ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      subject - the name of the subject the student graduated from

    • getCertificates

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getCertificates()
      Student's certificates ArrayList accessor method.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of certificates obtained by the student

    • hasCertificate

      public boolean hasCertificate​(Subject subject)
      Checks whether or not the student has already obtained the certificate for the input Subject.
      Parameters:
      subject - the name of the subject
      Returns:
      true if the student has already obtained the subject's certificate, false otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a pretty-print String of the subject.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a table-formatted string containing the student's name, gender, age, and certificate.
